ai.summary: A challenging coastal hike in the UK following the Durham Coastal Path for 38.4 km. The route features sea cliffs, beaches, and exposed sections, requiring good fitness, navigation, and weather prep.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal trail with cliff top paths, muddy or wet sections, sandy beaches, and rocky shorelines. Expect uneven footing, strong winds, and tidal considerations. Navigation relies on local markers and OS maps; some remote stretches have limited signposting.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for variable coastal weather and strong winds. Check tide times and potential closures for coastal sections. Wear sturdy waterproof boots, layered clothing, and a waterproof jacket. Carry a map and compass or GPS, and keep a charged phone with offline maps. Tell someone your route and expected finish time. Start early to maximize daylight, and consider splitting the hike into 2 days for 38.4 km. Be cautious of unstable cliffs, mud, and sudden waves at the shore.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing with a warm midlayer
Water bottle or hydration system (2â€“3 L)
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged phone with offline maps
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
First aid kit and blister care
Snacks and energy food; consider extra meals for multi-day
Dry bag or waterproof pouch for valuables

seo.title: Durham Coastal Path - 38.4 km Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Durham Coastal Path: a 38.4 km coastal hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and gear to plan your challenging coastal adventure.
